results.title: The Earth in motion
results.creator_credit: Walter Bartky and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Deals with the dynamic aspects of the earth as a planet. Demonstrates: 1. Sphericity. - 2. Axis rotation established by star trails and the Foucault pendulum. - 3. Revolution around the sun by the motion of the sun in respect of the stars and by the annual parallax of the stars.
results.description: Deals with the dynamic aspects of the earth as a planet. Demonstrates: 1. Sphericity. - 2. Axis rotation established by star trails and the Foucault pendulum. - 3. results.title: The Earth and its movement around the sun
results.brief_description: The earth with its tilted axis travels round the sun once every year. There are four important stages on this journey which are responsible for producing our four seasons: summer, autumn, winter and spring. The film details this journey.
results.title_for_label: The Earth and its movement around the sun
results.description: The earth with its tilted axis travels round the sun once every year. There are four important stages on this journey which are responsible for producing our four seasons: summer, autumn, winter and spring. The film details this journey.

results.title: The Earth's movements
results.brief_description: Shows four movements of the earth. Explains rotation and revolution and indicates how these account for day and night, time differences and the seasons. Illustrates the procession of the equinoxes and the galactic rotation. Suitable for secondary level.
results.description: Shows four movements of the earth. Explains rotation and revolution and indicates how these account for day and night, time differences and the seasons. Illustrates the procession of the equinoxes and the galactic rotation. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Earth
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Stanton Films and Media Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Provides information about the planet Earth - how its distance from the sun is the optimum distance for sustaining life, the notions of rotation and gravitational pull, the earth’s structure and the movement of the Earth’s crust, i.e., tectonic plates.

results.title: The Ears and hearing
results.brief_description: Structure and functions of the human ear and how sound waves are transmitted to the brain. Discusses hearing loss and physical malfunctioning and deterioration of the ear.

results.title: The Early years
results.creator_credit: Eileen Molony, George Inger, Bristol Education Authority and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”.
The importance of the early years of childhood is discussed by Dr. K. Lovell of the Institute of Education, University of Leeds, Dr. C.B. Hindley of the Centre for Study of Human Development, University of London, and Dr. W.A. Marshall of the Institute of Child Health, University of London.

results.title: The early films of Hans Richter = Ghosts before breakfast
results.brief_description: This surrealist experimental film was made in 1927 by artist-painter Hans Richter. The nazis destroyed the sound version of this film and classified it as “degenerate art”. The film shows everyday objects rebelling against their daily routine.
results.title_for_label: The early films of Hans Richter = Ghosts before breakfast

results.title: The Dynamic atmosphere
results.creator_credit: S.T. Evans, CSIRO and Roger Seccombe
results.brief_description: This film shows how the technicians and scientists of CSIRO measures aspects of the atmosphere. This includes experiments on “rotational” effects and their relevance to climatic disturbances. It shows the influence of cloud types on solar and infra-red radiation streams, and features an explanation of the ozone layer. Narrated by Keith Livingstone.
